text: Leonard Bilson (1616–1695) was M.P. for Petersfield during the late 17th century.History of Parliament On-line Bilson was born on 5 December 1616, the third (second surviving) son of Sir Thomas Bilson of West Mapledurham and his wife Susanna, daughter of Sir William Uvedale . He was educated at University College, Oxford,Alumni Oxonienses 1500-1714 graduating B.A. on 5 February 1635, and M.A. on 31 October 1637. His son Thomas succeeded him as MP.'One hundred years of a pocket borough: Petersfield and Parliament, 1685-1783' Surry, N. p7: Petersfield; Petersfield Area Historical Society (Paper No. 7); 1983 ==References== Category:People from Hampshire Category:17th-century English people Category:English MPs 1661–1679 Category:English MPs 1679 Category:English MPs 1680–1681 Category:1616 births Category:1695 deaths Category:Alumni of University College, Oxford
title: Leonard Bilson (1616–1695)
